Andhra Pradesh, Telangana Weather LATEST Update: Rain, Heatwave Forecast For Summer Issued
Andhra Pradesh, Telangana Weather LATEST Update: Winter is pretty much over.. summer has begun. The Telangana Weatherman predicts that rains will also pick up during this time. Here's what this summer is expected to be like
Rains are inevitable in summer..
Wondering about rain in summer? It happens, and this year it's starting early. The Telangana Weatherman says Feb, Mar, and Apr will see both sun and rain due to the El Ni√±o effect.
Rains this month...
Half of February is already over... the cold has reduced and the heat has started. According to the Telangana Weatherman, in the coming days, not only will the heat intensify, but rains will also start here and there. He warns that there will be rain for three months... and then the real summer will begin. The Weatherman revealed that May and June will see scorching heat with very high temperatures recorded.
SUMMER 2026 PRELIMINARY FORECAST
EL- NINO IS COMING üî•
The first half of summer which includes Feb 2nd half, March, April will be RAINY and normal summer heat is expected üåßÔ∏è
The second half of summer will be DRIER with MASSIVE HEATWAVES expected during May, June 1st half üî•‚Ä¶‚Äî Telangana Weatherman (@balaji25_t) January 16, 2026
2023 situation in 2026...
The Weatherman warns that 2023's weather patterns will repeat, with a longer summer. The southwest monsoon will be delayed, meaning unavoidable heat and humidity until it arrives.
Cold for another two days...
Currently, the Hyderabad Met Centre says minimum temps may drop 2-3 degrees in the next 2 days, with dry weather continuing. On Feb 12, some districts will see 11-15¬∞C temps.
Lowest temperatures in Telangana are here..
On Feb 11, the lowest temperatures were 12.8¬∞C in Medak and 13.7¬∞C in Adilabad. Other areas saw temps from 15.8¬∞C to 18¬∞C. The highest was 32.5¬∞C in Adilabad and Nizamabad.

articles.title: Hyderabad Heatwave Warning? Temperatures Soar To 35¬∞C In February As Winter Bids Goodbye Across Telangana - News18

articles.full_text:
Hyderabad Heatwave Warning? Temperatures Soar To 35¬∞C In February As Winter Bids Goodbye Across Telangana
Hyderabad braces for rising February heat as temperatures climb to 35¬∞C under clear skies. No rain forecast across Telangana; experts advise hydration and sun safety.
Hyderabad is set to experience a steady rise in temperatures as winter gradually loosens its grip over Telangana. According to the latest forecast, the city will witness mostly clear skies on Thursday, February 12, 2026, with daytime heat intensifying as the sun climbs higher.
While early morning hours may bring mild, cool breezes offering temporary relief, the warmth is expected to build rapidly after sunrise. The maximum temperature in Hyderabad is likely to hover between 33¬∞C and 35¬∞C, slightly above the average for February.
Recommended Stories
- Telangana Weather Update: Nights Turn Pleasant In Hyderabad As Daytime Heat Gradually Rises
- TS ICET 2026 Notification: Registration Begins February 12, Check Exam Schedule
- TS ICET 2026 Application Begins At icet.tgche.ac.in: Direct Link, Exam Schedule
- 'BRS Extorted Crores Of Money, Grabbed Land': Telangana CM Revanth Reddy On Phone-Tapping Row
Night and early morning temperatures are expected to remain relatively comfortable, ranging between 17¬∞C and 19¬∞C.
Meteorologists note that humidity levels could dip to around 20‚Äì30% during the afternoon, contributing to dry weather conditions. In some busy parts of the city, the Air Quality Index (AQI) is likely to remain in the ‚ÄòModerate‚Äô category.
Weather Across Telangana
The impact of rising heat is not limited to Hyderabad alone. Several districts across Telangana are already experiencing warmer-than-usual conditions for this time of year.
Northern Districts: Nizamabad, Adilabad: In northern Telangana, particularly in Nizamabad and Adilabad, daytime temperatures may touch the 35¬∞C mark. However, cooler nights continue, creating noticeable temperature variations between day and night.
Eastern Districts: Khammam, Warangal: In districts such as Khammam and Warangal, dry weather is expected to prevail. Reduced moisture in the air may lead to discomfort during peak afternoon hours, especially for those spending extended time outdoors.
Rainfall Outlook: The Meteorological Department has clarified that there are currently no weather systems, troughs, or low-pressure areas influencing Telangana. As a result, no rainfall is forecast across the state in the immediate future. Clear skies and dry conditions are expected to dominate.
Advisory for Residents
With February temperatures already climbing above seasonal norms, experts recommend precautionary measures to avoid heat-related discomfort.
Stay Hydrated: Dry weather increases the risk of dehydration. Residents are advised to drink sufficient water throughout the day, even if they do not feel excessively thirsty.
Sun Protection: Those stepping out between 12 pm and 4 pm, when the sun is at its strongest, should consider using umbrellas, caps, or protective clothing to reduce direct sun exposure.
Morning and Night Chill: Despite warm afternoons, early mornings can still feel cool. Parents and caregivers should ensure that children and elderly individuals remain protected from sudden temperature fluctuations, particularly to avoid respiratory issues.
Overall, the prevailing weather pattern indicates that summer-like conditions are gradually setting in across Telangana. As the sun‚Äôs intensity strengthens day by day, residents are urged to stay cautious and adapt to the changing climate conditions.
